text.content:
Combat Actions

Core actions available during your turn in combat

Actions in Combat

On your turn, you can move a distance up to your Speed and take one action. You can also take one Bonus Action and one Reaction per round.

Main Actions

Attack

Make one attack roll with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike. You can equip or unequip one weapon before or after the attack.

  • Moving Between Attacks: If you have Extra Attack, you can move between attacks

Dash

Gain extra movement equal to your Speed (after modifiers). You can choose which speed to use if you have multiple speeds (Fly, Swim, etc.).

Disengage

Your movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks for the rest of your turn.

Dodge

Until the start of your next turn:

  • Attack rolls against you have Disadvantage (if you can see attacker)
  • You make Dexterity saving throws with Advantage
  • You lose these benefits if Incapacitated or Speed is 0

Help

Aid an ally with a task, giving them Advantage on their next ability check, or assist in attacking a creature within 5 feet of you, giving an ally Advantage on their next attack against that creature.

Hide

Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide. You can't hide from a creature that can see you clearly.

Ready

Prepare an action to take as a Reaction in response to a specified trigger. You decide on the trigger and the action when you Ready.

Search

Make a Wisdom (Perception) check or Intelligence (Investigation) check to find something.

Utilize

Use an object, such as a potion, magic item, or piece of adventuring gear. Some objects require an action to use.

Bonus Actions

Various class features, spells, and abilities grant the ability to take a Bonus Action. You can take only one Bonus Action per turn.

Two-Weapon Fighting

When you take the Attack action and attack with a Light weapon in one hand, you can make one Bonus Action attack with a different Light weapon in your other hand.

Reactions

You can take one Reaction per round. Common reactions include:

Opportunity Attack

When a creature you can see moves out of your reach, you can use your Reaction to make one melee attack against that creature. The attack occurs before the creature leaves your reach.

Other Activities

  • Interact with Object: Once per turn as part of movement or action (open door, draw weapon, etc.)
  • Don or Doff Shield: Requires an action
  • End Concentration: No action required
  • Escape a Grapple: Make an ability check as an action
